name: alumna
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a woman who studied at a particular school, college, or university: She is a proud alumna of the University of Colorado, Denver. Graduates of women's colleges, she argues, benefit from a supportive network of alumnae. Compare
grad mainly US
graduate noun
a woman who worked for a particular organization, was involved in a particular TV show, etc., earlier in her working life: She is an alumna of Procter & Gamble. She is one of the legendary comedy show's many alumnae. Compare
alumnus
More examplesFewer examplesShe was honoured by the school as an outstanding alumna.Oxford University famously refused to give an honorary doctorate to its old alumna, Lady Thatcher.The Women's Leadership Conference, founded in 1993, now has thousands of alumnae statewide.The "West Wing" alumna gives a stunning performance in a supporting role.
